intro: Narcissus gigas, commonly known as the giant daffodil, is a striking member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers with a prominent yellow corona and broad, strap-like petals. Native to the Iberian Peninsula, this species thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with a robust rhizomatous root system. Its blooming period occurs in early spring, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
